Name: Penannular ear-ring
Description: Hollow gold penannular ear-ring, dented on the inner side at one end. The ear-ring became popular in Egypt under Nubian and Asiatic influence after the 2nd Intermediate Period, and by the mid-18th Dynasty, kings too had their ears pierced. The penannular type is one of several introduced at that time. From the late 18th Dynasty the type is encountered in non-royal burials.
